stream_context.summary: Kaze works live on the new Oil-Rig course (roughly Course 11) of "Return to Yoshi’s Island": polishing the ‘mess-with-Bowser’s-workers’ first mission, coding a breakable glass window, timing Koopa animations, debating (and scrapping) an oil-barrel gag, creating a hard-hat Wiggler foreman model, and planning an optional Wing-Cap bonus. Zeina animates a baby-penguin NPC while Kaze reviews Badub’s rough music track.

development_findings.summary: First mission of the Oil-Rig level is almost finished; it will ship with four ‘troll’ interactions instead of five after the oil-barrel idea was cut.
development_findings.quote: “We can also just go with only four ways to mess with them… I think oil guy is gone.”

development_findings.summary: Breakable glass is implemented by splitting the pane into two pre-cut pieces and hard-coding their flight path instead of real physics to save time and polygons.
development_findings.quote: “We’re just gonna fake it so we don’t actually have to write a physics simulation.”

development_findings.summary: Koopas carrying the glass have new up-and-down / back-and-forth animations synced every 12.5 frames (25-frame loop). They switch to a ‘sad’ state and dialogue once the window is broken.
Dialogue placeholders added: angry lines before sabotage and paycheck-loss complaints afterward, emphasising Bowser’s harsh labour policies.
development_findings.quote: “That’s gonna come out of my paycheck…”

development_findings.summary: Optional Wing-Cap will be hidden on a crane/rope path; soft invisible walls will keep players from seeing unrendered areas.
Zeina is producing all new baby-penguin animations (walk, waddle, slide, get-up, idle). Kaze resolved rig issues and T-pose resetting in Blender.

A Wiggler overseer NPC is being built with boots and a single hard hat (reduced from multiple hats to stay under ~700 polygons). He’ll grow angrier as each troll is completed and eventually flee, spawning the star.
Lighting: global ambient light is currently very dark; Kaze may tweak it because Wing-Cap wings can turn black.
Four courses remain after Oil-Rig; ten are already playable, keeping the overall project on track.
Engine compiles quickly and hits 60 FPS on real N64 hardware; Fast64 export improvements will require re-exporting many models later.

context_findings.summary: Kaze reflects on earlier hack (‘Last Impact’) and now spends more time on design before coding to avoid feature bloat.
context_findings.quote: “Back when I was making Last Impact I spent like maybe 5 % of the time designing… I should have been spending at least 20 %.”

context_findings.summary: He dislikes 2D platformers and insists on full-analog or mouse precision; sees controller-plus-mouse hybrids as the future.
Works remotely for Gears for Breakfast (A Hat in Time) doing optimisation, prefers WFH over physical offices, bound by NDA.
Admits accepting free hardware from Chinese manufacturers for reviews; finances tight while house-hunting (“I need those $20”).
Expresses pro-worker views (paid lunch breaks, Bowser’s OSHA violations) and laughs at labour-law jokes.

biobak.summary: Absent from stream; running joke to assign him an ‘Andrew Tate theme song’, implying playful teasing when he returns.

badub.summary: Delivered a rough oil-rig level track; Kaze likes the ideas but notes it’s unfinished.
badub.quote: “Oh yeah, you guys haven’t heard it yet but Badub made a soundtrack for this level… some of this wasn’t perfect yet but I like a lot of the ideas.”

zeina.summary: Animating baby-penguin NPC (walk, waddle, slide, idle) and will handle the complex Wiggler foreman; collaborates live with Kaze in Blender.
Moderates chat occasionally but primary role is animation; Kaze reminds viewers she’s not the chat rep.
zeina.quote: “Zaina is not writing chat… She is working on her own stuff.”

key_stories.title: Faking the Glass Shatter
key_stories.summary: Kaze needs a convincing glass-breaking moment without taxing N64 hardware. After debating many small shards, he opts for two pre-cut pieces with hard-coded motion.
key_stories.challenge: Realistic physics and many shards would exceed polygon and workload budgets.
key_stories.process: Experimented with multiple shards → calculated frame timings → wrote hard-coded fall and rotation.
key_stories.outcome: Visual effect looks believable; triggers Koopa state change and dialogue.
key_stories.key_quote: We’re just gonna fake it so we don’t actually have to write a physics simulation.

key_stories.title: The Scrapped Oil-Barrel Gag
key_stories.summary: Originally, a dripping oil barrel was to be kicked to make a worker slip, but Kaze decides it’s too cryptic and not funny enough.
key_stories.challenge: Designing a fifth ‘troll’ interaction that players would intuitively discover.
key_stories.process: Discussed visuals and mechanics live, weighed comedic value vs. clarity.
key_stories.outcome: Idea dropped; mission will ship with four trolls instead of five.
key_stories.key_quote: Kicking the oil barrel is not intuitive and also that’s not very funny.

key_stories.title: Designing the Wiggler Foreman
key_stories.summary: A special Wiggler oversees the site. Kaze and Zeina iterate on boots, hard hats, and segment sizes while battling polygon limits.
key_stories.challenge: Character must read as a foreman yet stay under ~700 polygons for performance.
key_stories.process: Tried multiple hats → too costly → settled on one hat, larger boots, resized head, removed inner helmet faces.
key_stories.outcome: Model finalised at 671 polys; animations still to come.
key_stories.key_quote: A thousand triangles is too much… I can’t waste my polygon budget like that.
